meanings.definition: Lucrativeness: the quality of being profitable or financially rewarding.
meanings.sent1: The lucrativeness of the investment was evident from the high returns.
meanings.sent2: She was attracted to the job because of its lucrativeness.
meanings.sent3: The lucrativeness of selling ice to polar bears would be quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The lucrativeness of the opportunity shone like a golden coin in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The lucrativeness of the business deal sparkled like a treasure chest waiting to be opened.

meanings.definition: Lucrativeness: the state of being advantageous or beneficial in terms of gaining wealth.
meanings.sent1: The lucrativeness of saving money became clear when unexpected expenses arose.
meanings.sent2: Investing in education can lead to long-term lucrativeness.
meanings.sent3: The lucrativeness of winning the lottery would be quite surprising.
meanings.sent4: The lucrativeness of the idea glowed like a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The lucrativeness of the new business strategy gleamed like a diamond in the rough.
